Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the impact of the agricultural reforms on farmers by using images depicting the plight of farmers.
Lack enough support: The claim may lack enough supporting evidence to prove that the agricultural reforms will not ensure Minimum Support Price (MSP) on agricultural produce.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that shutting down the mandi system will threaten the development of rural India without providing sufficient evidence or explanation for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or perspectives regarding the agricultural reforms and their potential impact on farmers.
